title: Understanding Gamma Knife
text: Gamma knife treatment is a type of radiosurgery. It is often used to treat brain tumors and other brain disorders. It is called 'gamma knife' because it uses gamma rays to target and treat the affected area.

title: Noninvasive Procedure
text: Unlike traditional surgery, gamma knife treatment does not involve any incisions. It is a noninvasive procedure, meaning it does not require opening the skull or making cuts in the body.

title: Use of Radiation
text: Gamma knife treatment uses focused beams of radiation to target and destroy abnormal tissue in the brain. This precision helps minimize damage to surrounding healthy tissue.
